website_summaries.verdict: Philips is an industry leader in LED bulbs, and these have been favorably compared to incandescents. However, the stark brightness of these bulbs may be too much for some people.
pros: Lumens and light color are comparable to incandescent bulbs
Not as bulky as CFL bulbs
cons: The light tint (cool yellow) is not "warm" enough for some people
Not suitable for all indoor uses

customer_reviews.title: They start going dead after a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought it last year, around July 2016. Now, July 2017 three of them have gone dead. They start going dead one by one. So much for 10 year life time.
customer_reviews.author: Anonimo

customer_reviews.title: Great price, not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: 60w, everyday plastic version. Great price. However, our commercial application (elevator cabs, on 24/7) proves this are not going to last. In 3 months, we have lost 12 out of 16 bulbs. As a comparison, the Walmart great value brand bulbs in another 2 cabs installed a year ago are still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I was looking to save some money long term on bulb replacement and on my electric bill in general. So I purchased these LED bulbs hoping to reach this goal. It hasn't even been a year yet and 4 out of the 16 bulbs have stopped working. This is very disappointing because these are supposed to last many years and still only worked as long as a regular light bulb. Do your research and make sure your picking the right bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Rane

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love the daylight bulbs! Winters in Alaska can be tough, but I'm hoping the natural looking light will help. The yellow looking lights are regular bulbs and the white ones are the daylight.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT BACK UP THEIR WRITTEN WARRANTY
customer_reviews.text: 8 of 16 bulbs failed within a few weeks. guarantee of 3 years with 3 hour per day use, general use, not with dimmers. I put in ceiling fans, no dimmers. when failed, I called Phillips. they went thru stalling investigation, and denied claim for either new bulbs or reimbursement, saying they are not recommended for ceiling fans. NOWHERE on the box or 4 bulb package does it say this. Says for general use. Let the buyer beware!.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna K. Vickrey

customer_reviews.title: but they're great in lamps and hallways and bathrooms
customer_reviews.text: These lights are absolutely blinding to look directly at lol. I wouldn't use them in open casings in main areas, but they're great in lamps and hallways and bathrooms. Obviously can also make you look like a model.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Prewitt

customer_reviews.title: NO customer support hope they work for you.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bulbs February, 2017. They were installed in a open globe fan that is rarely used. Two of them have failed. When I attempted to file a warranty claim with Philips they have NO record of this bulb on their website. I understand products can fail, but offering a warranty and making it impossible to file a claim is bad business. I leave you with this quote from Philips. "No results were found. Please try a different search."
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Wow these are super BRIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: Wow these are super BRIGHT!! We are slowly replacing all of our ordinary light bulbs with LED light bulbs so this was kind of a test batch purchase for us. We were pleasantly surprised and will be coming back for more! FYI the 5.5 watt light bulb (40 watt equivalent) is much brighter than most 40 watt bulbs, I'd say it gives off about as much light as a 60 watt light bulb so keep this in mind when replacing bathroom light bulbs, unless you're going for the super bright look.
customer_reviews.author: ChickenNuggets

customer_reviews.title: At about 6 months they start to 'blink' on and off like a strobe
customer_reviews.text: One year later all 16 dead. They simply can't put up with continuous use. At about 6 months they start to 'blink' on and off like a strobe.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Strohs

customer_reviews.title: These are just absolutely wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping to cut down the electric bill and to very brightly illuminate my garage and basement. These are just absolutely wonderful!!! If you don't want to very brightly illuminate a space then I don't recommend getting the daylight bulbs but for my purposes they're brilliant. I switched all the bulbs, not just the duds, because I loved these bulbs and the light they give off so much. Can't recommend these enough!
customer_reviews.author: Emily K.

customer_reviews.title: Not Suitable For Enclosed Fixtures :(
customer_reviews.text: Not suitable for enclosed fixtures. This should be front and center. I didn't even know this was a thing I had to worry about. Yet, it's printed right on the side of the bulb (not in the product listing). I'm frustrated, because I just replaced 16 standard bulbs with these LED bulbs, and it sounds like they'll start going dead in a year or so since they will overheat in the enclosed fixtures. If I have to buy LED bulbs again in the near future, I will be using 1000bulbs instead, because their site lists this info in each product's description/specs.
customer_reviews.author: James N.

customer_reviews.title: A Year Later...
customer_reviews.text: Greetings. After a year of normal use. 4 bulbs have failed. Pretty disappointed considering I spent extra to buy Philips brand in the hopes of getting a better cost effective product... At this point, don't think the rest are gonna last 5-10 year's of normal use. Thanks for the time you took to read this. Have a great day.
customer_reviews.author: DotDashDot

customer_reviews.title: Buzzzzz, flicker flicker
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs buzz and flicker as if I were in a horror movie. Honestly the worst LED lightbulbs I've ever purchased. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jones

customer_reviews.title: 40w equivalent draws 6.5w, not the 5.5w stated on the product page
customer_reviews.text: We specifically bought this brand 40w equivalent LED bulb because it was stated to draw only 5.5w. The image from the manufacturer, the title, and the description all state 5.5w. However, when we received the bulbs (shipped and sold by Amazon) they actually draw 6.5w. It is stated as such on the retail packaging and it is on the bulb (see photo). In all reality it is a trivial difference, however the chandelier we are using these in requires 14 bulbs. That 1w difference is now 14w. The color and brightness are as expected. They are light weight compared to some other LED bulbs we have so only time will tell if they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They do not last - a disappointment from Philips
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 2 years ago and about half have burnt out since then. The latest just caused me to look up my old order and write a review. TBH, I thought it was one of the amazon basics I bought that burnt out. But low and behold, this is now 3 Philips in the last couple months alone. This is disappointing, as I've bought other Philips LED bulbs (the old 'flat profile" style) about 4 years ago, and not a single one of them have failed yet. I'll be looking elsewhere as I replace these going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: 3 of 5 installed burned out
customer_reviews.text: False advertising. Everything about these lights was fine until they approached the 1 year mark. Then 3 of the 5 installed bulbs started flickering and burned out shortly after. Cutting them open reveals burned circuit components. Their listing says, "Each light bulb is expected to deliver a lifetime of up to 10,950 hours and 10 years of light" Their warranty is for 2 years only at 3 hours per day. And then you have to pay to return the defective bulb. A 4th just started flickering as I write this. No more Philips products for me.
customer_reviews.author: EvTech

customer_reviews.title: All of the bulbs worked great. However
customer_reviews.text: All of the bulbs worked great. However, they cause interference with my garage door opener. I am absolutely certain it was these lights. I tried a regular incandescent, it was fine. What was in there was a compact fluorescent, it was fine. This, it would be fine if the light was off. If the light was on, the garage door would not respond until the light went off. The lights themselves work well and none of the 16 were duds. I just wish they didn't have any interference.
customer_reviews.author: wseibert

customer_reviews.title: I only buy these bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I have probably 50+ of the BR30 throughout my house and they're awesome. The right level of light, warm, no flicker, and dim nicely. When I swapped the ones in the entry light, they were bright freaking blue so I went to seek out the phillips BR30 little brother for this light to get rid of the megamind blue entry and get them back to warm and neutral. My only gripe is I wish they had a brighter version as everything is on dimmers, I can easily make it darker, but they only get so bright. Wonderful product, excellent lifespan so far, and really look classy. I can trust this product.
customer_reviews.author: DesertScottAZ

customer_reviews.title: Not for fully enclosed light fixtures
customer_reviews.text: These work fine. However, I was annoyed to find a tiny print warning on the bulbs saying "not for use in totally enclosed luminaries". Apparently using them in those can impact how long they last because they get too hot and burn out. Most of my lights are enclosed fixtures, and a limitation like that should be prominently stated in the product description or at least on the packaging, not in tiny print on the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph M.

customer_reviews.title: 10 years?  Hardly
customer_reviews.text: The ad states: These Philips LED bulbs last 10x longer than incandescent and halogen bulbs. Each light bulb is expected to deliver a lifetime of up to 10,950 hours and 10 years of light (based on three hours per day), saving you the cost of frequent bulb replacement. Over half of these have failed in a little over two years with much less than the stated usage. Don't know if these are any lousier than any of the others, but if I'm being forced to pay a huge premium over incandescents, I'd expect them to live up to at least half their stated promise.
customer_reviews.author: WLRNC

customer_reviews.title: CRAP, CRAP, CRAP
customer_reviews.text: One star because the are, not to be crass, but. Well here goes. They are crap, not one has lasted more than 6 months. Not one. I thought after the first went out in less than a week that it was a fluk. But i have used them in different fixtures in different rooms and even a different house. And not a dam one lasted any where near as lone as the should. If i could i would give them ZERO stars.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Good price, bad color rendering (daylight)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pack of these on sale, and they work fine, but I'm rather disappointed with what Phillips is calling "daylight" here. I now know that just because it says daylight doesn't mean it's the same temperature. I purchased a set of HyperIkon bulbs in "daylight" (4000K) and they have much better color rendering. It genuinely looks like my house is being lit by sunlight. These make it looks like it's being lit by a fluorescent bulb. I'm debating returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Economy led light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs work very well providing light at reduced energy usage. One issue is that they must be used in areas where there is background noise as their constant hum is annoying. Compared to other brands of led bulbs that I have used, these are loud. Again, if used in an area where there is background noise, there is no problem. But if used in an otherwise quiet area, there a very annoying hum or buss from these bulbs. I listed these a being "recommended to a friend" but only with the stipulations regarding noise.
customer_reviews.author: GrandBuffet

customer_reviews.title: Terrific globe light replacements! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 40 watt equivalent LEDs as a replacement for clear 40 watt globe vanity incandescent bulbs. The two vanity lights each have 8 bulbs. These replacements are fantastic! The round bulbs look great as exposed bulbs. I like a cool white light for a truer colors, adn these definitely provide that. The lumens are more than adequate and energy savings are awesome. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tempestfugit

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE BULBS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these bulbs!! Within an hour the glass broke around the threading and blew off the fixture. I thought the first one might have been a fluke but it happened again with a second bulb. This happened above a toddlers bed 😡. We had the same type of bulb (60w led) in the fixture before these bulbs. Called Philips to make a complaint and they said they couldn’t do anythinh until they did testing which can take up to 6 weeks. These bulbs are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany S.

customer_reviews.title: Very good value when buying for the whole house. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased a new how and the builder put CFL bulbs in every fixture. They were horrible, not to mention they're extremely bad for your health so, I counted the number of bulbs needed to replace and found these LED's on Amazon and ordered 2 boxes. We couldn't be more pleased with them. We choose the brighter, daylight, version in the standard plastic rather than the traditional glass, which is also an option and it really made a huge difference in all of the rooms. These are non-dimmable which isn't a problem for us, so just be aware of that. Every bulb worked so, zero defects.
customer_reviews.author: Mark and Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Like the bulbs, but eight of 32 bulbs have failed in two years
customer_reviews.text: On par with other reviewers here, the bulbs produce nice light, no noticeable hum, and for a decent price. I purchased 32 and 1/4 of them (at least) have failed within two years, in mixed usage across pretty much every type of light fixture we have in the house. It seems to be a quality issue, not related to usage levels. Notably this issue has been a bigger problem with the 60-Watt version. Annoyingly, about half of them failed while in the chandelier in our entryway, which requires a ladder for changing the bulbs...I submitted a warranty claim. Will update based on Philips Response.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa I

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible and so is there customer service. I had 2 bulbs burn out after 2.5 years (supposed to last 10) so I called Phillip's and after 15 minutes on the phone with the rep who repeatedly asked me the same questions, wanted multiple photos sent, questioned my outlet, asked about my light fixtures, I just gave up. I'm guessing that's their goal. That's fine, but I won't ever be buying their products again.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei

customer_reviews.title: Reviewing after a year, the bulbs still works great
customer_reviews.text: I think I am reviewing this product after using these bulbs for more than a year. It is the best product ever. All the bulbs are still so bright and so much efficient even after a year+ Instead of buying one or two, go for this pack and you will thank me later. I have saved so many bucks with this pack of bulbs. Energy efficient as well as super bright. I love to have so many bulbs in my home without hole in the pocket. It served my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: sri v.

customer_reviews.title: Good Color and Brightness
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for a multiple bulb fixture that had been using 60 watt incandescent bulbs. I tried standard replacements and they were too bright and too "white" of light. These bulbs gave the same light output at about 450 lumens with a slightly "yellow" light at 2,700 K color range. trading power consumption of 2,400 watts for the old to the new 22 watts is a great trade for the additional cost of the new LED bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: jamesmid

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Bright lights to replace Incandescent with
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a long-term project to replace every bulb in my home with an LED equivalent. I strongly recommend these bulbs. At the time of writing, I've purchased 2x 16 packs from Philips, and not a single bulb has been damaged or gone bad. I additionally have invested in the Philips Hue line if you're looking for something a bit more than this. If you're replacing lights that are in fixtures and the light isn't exposed, get a Daylight bulb. They are much brighter than an incandescent, and produce a much nicer color (White instead of Yellow).
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Energy efficient, bright, and cool to the touch
customer_reviews.text: I changed all the bulbs in my house at once and I estimate that they paid for themselves within 6 months. My electric bill is considerably less each month and the heat that they expend is almost nothing. These bulbs are fantastic, brighter than my old incandescent and compact fluorescents. After 2.5 years, I have not had to replace any of them!!!!! I highly recommend them. Just WOW!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it Once--Shame on Me, Buy it Twice...Shame on You Philips
customer_reviews.text: I recently had 3 bulbs of these go out. So I--like an idiot--bought another box of these to replace the 3 bulbs that went out and a few more incandescent bulbs that were dead. The prior bulbs from the first package lasted about 18 months. The new package has one bulb that just completely doesn't work. DOA. None of these are on dimmers; there is simply no reason for these to have died so quickly, have sporadic flickering, and one to show up completely dead. I'll be picking something else up in the future--too bad since these are actually pretty decent bulbs when they are working.
customer_reviews.author: DancingDuo

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for LED Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Starting having failures within the first year. After 3 years almost all of them have failed, even though most of them have not been in use the entire time. All were in lamps and open lighting. Getting them replaced is the most hassle I've ever had getting something replaced. I currently have several dead bulbs and may just buy another brand instead of going through the process.
customer_reviews.author: Sean H.

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy.  Lasted 1/3 of claimed life.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to receive and install these lights all over my house. The two most used lights are identical lamps that go on at night for ~6-8 hours. They lasted NOWHERE NEAR the claimed lifespan. Using 7 hours/day @450 days installed = 3150 hours which is probably a bit of an overestimate. Claiming 10 years and 10,000 hours, these bulbs lasted me 450 days and just over 3000 hours, not even a third of the claimed lifespan. While perhaps I have some kind of electrical issues (house is 8 years old so unlikely) I am considering taking some kind of further action against Phillips for these potentially provable false claims.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Don't last any longer than regular bulbs. Don't waste your money on these.
customer_reviews.text: Don't last any longer than regular bulbs. What's the point? I barely get a year, sometimes less out these. Bought some replacements locally at Home Depot, but even they started going dead after a few months. Called Philips, and they sent me out a few replacements, after they asked me send pictures of the receipts and boxes, but I don't hold much hope for them either. The guy at Philips customer service actually told me it might be the electric wiring in my house that's causing the bulbs not to last. I guess the fact that the florescent bulbs last for years doesn't matter, huh? Won't be buying these ever again.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a daylight bulb, or Soft White - This is UGLY YELLOW 1970s looking light bulb color
customer_reviews.text: UGLY YELLOW BULB. Tried 2, from 2 different 4 packs in my order. Pure garbage butter vomit yellow, and not even very bright. Huge disappointment as I have order this exact product in the past and loved them. I even ordered this time via my order history to make sure I had the exact same product! IT'S NOT A DAYLIGHT BULB, IT'S NOT SOFT WHITE. IT IS YELLOW, YELLOW, YELLOW AND DULL.
customer_reviews.author: Temecula

customer_reviews.title: They do not last 10,000 hours
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these bulbs October 17, 2017. The ones that are used more frequently have been burning out one after the other lately. They are not left on all day and night, but even if they were left on 14 hours a day for the last 500 days, that’s only 7000 hours. Considering the claim is that they would last over 10,000 hours, and I know they have not been on 14 hours a day every single day, I would say that these did not live up to their claim.
customer_reviews.author: ciara

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, excellent light quality.
customer_reviews.text: At just a little over a buck fifty per bulb, these are perfect for replacing old incandescent bulbs or those slow starting CFL's. Not only do they use a fraction of the electricity, they generate a lot less heat so you save on your air conditioning bill as well. They're supposed to last 10 years or more, but I just opened the box today so I have no idea if they'll make it that long. Phillips guarantees them for 3 years. Light quality is excellent, no flickering, and a very nice warm white color. Keep in mind they are not dimmable even with an LED rated dimmer switch.
customer_reviews.author: BKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awful quality control.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these day-light light bulbs back in 2016. Had a couple failed during last 3 years but most are still going strong. I liked it and re-ordered exact same light bulbs from my purchased history. Such a disappointment because twice I got soft white light bulbs with 2700-kelvin instead. The sticker on the package says day light 5000K but inside are soft white light bulbs with 2700k. One star for Amazon customer service. They tried to accommodate and correct the situation. But it was not much to be done because it packaged wrong from the manufacture. I had to order light bulbs with an unknown brand and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: On my way to an all LED house
customer_reviews.text: We just bought a house and one of the first things I started doing was switching out those daggum CFL lights (I have always hated those things) for LEDs. Being able to buy the 16 packs for a decent price has made that a whole lot easier. These are a nice bright daylight color and really have a fresh feel to the light. The bases heat up a bit but the bulb itself stays cool while it's lit, which is nice. I haven't heard any buzzing or anything like that so, so far I am very pleased with these. If I ever actually need to replace one I'll be happy to get more.
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: These would be perfect in a hospital OR!  MY EYES!  MY EYES!
customer_reviews.text: Good grief are these bulbs WHITE! I have a kitchen fixture that requires 4 bulbs and when I installed these the entire kitchen became... STERILE! I must have missed this in the reviews. I suspect these will work okay in a bathroom single bulb fixture. If whitest, brightest white is what you're looking for, these are for you. However if you prefer a more traditional 60w color temp... Look elsewhere. Wish I could return the 12 I have left, but I threw away the box the first 4 came in. :( Oh well, we'll use them in the outhouse I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Gdubz

customer_reviews.title: Start going dead after one year
customer_reviews.text: I have had these bulbs for just over a year now, and within two weeks, I have lost 5 out of the 16 I bought. They say that they have a 10 year life, and are warrantied to three years, but it's a hassle to ship them back to Philips. Old incandescent bulbs lasted much, much longer at a fraction of the cost (even factoring in the efficiency). I'm not impressed at all. 5/28/2019 update: I now have 10 out of the 16 that have failed. Very, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M Guest

customer_reviews.title: Not as long lasting as advertised
customer_reviews.text: LED light bulbs are more expensive than your incandescent variety so one of the benefits you expect is that they are long lasting (up to 10,000 hrs as advertised). Around May 2017, I bought the pack of 16 and replaced all the incandescent light bulbs in my house. I bought the Philips brands because I was looking for quality. It started off okay and I had no complaints but as of Aug 2018 (14/15 months), 4 of these have burnt out (25%). That failure rate is way too high! I will add that I did submit a claim and Philips responded and replaced the light bulbs but a 25% failure rate seems high to me.
customer_reviews.author: 'Meka Oh em gee

customer_reviews.title: ☹ printed on the lightbulb "NOT FOR USE IN TOTALLY ENCLOSED LUMINAIRES"
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it says on the lightbulb that this is "NOT FOR USE IN TOTALLY ENCLOSED LUMINAIRES". A lot of the bulbs that I want to replace are inside an enclosed/fully enclosed light fixture. ☹ I do NOT understand why it is so extremely difficult & hard to find a lightbulb (especially an affordable lightbulb) that is okay in an enclosed light fixture... :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Philips lacks quality control
customer_reviews.text: I got one bulb that was dead on arrival. I've seemed to have better luck with other LED bulb manufacturers. Philips bulbs seem to be hit and miss. Don't get me wrong, when the bulb does work they seem good. I've now just had too many that hum or buzz or just plain don't light straight out of the box. They seem to lack in the quality control department. I can't recommend any Philips bulbs for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Amulek

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly amazing value. All arrived on time without a scratch
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly amazing value. All arrived on time without a scratch. It was economical enough at this price to re-lamp the entire house, which we did, we are now 100% LED at 1/5th of both wattage and energy usage for lighting, and it's far brighter. We ordered the 5000k bright white bulbs got rid of the yellow of the "warm" bulbs and with our senior eyesight have less strain. Initial investment is a little steep (not all fixtures used these cheaper bulbs) but I feel it is truly worth it. since average bulb life is 10 years plus that's plenty of time to recoup the cost in energy savings.
customer_reviews.author: Philip B. Hale Jr

customer_reviews.title: Stick with Philips. Costco's Feit electic is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I notice that LED bulbs with "excessive" circuitry fail quicker than old school Edison's filament bulbs (remember those 60watt monsters???). These are the simplest bulbs and having run Philips LEDs for at least 7 years I can tell you to stick with Philips. My brother would pay something crazy like $20 a Philips bulb over a decade ago when they first appeared, and I think he got every single one still working. I had no idea these where LED filament type of bulb, which is the simplest most reliable design. Come think of it I don't remember a Philips LED bulb go bad on me yet :)
customer_reviews.author: Michael the II

customer_reviews.title: High Fail Rate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack of bulbs 3 years ago and at this point at least half of them have died, and they weren't being used in lights that we leave on all day or anything like that. I see that it has a 3-year warranty, but seriously, am I going to jump through the warranty hoops to get replacements for these as they die off, one at a time?
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Replace your florescent and incandescent bulbs
customer_reviews.text: If you changed your bulbs out with florescent bulbs you need to change to LED. Florescent bulbs have Mercury, apparently the Administration that all but outlawed incandescent bulbs missed the big picture. Mercury is still toxic. You really need to dispose of florescent bulbs properly they are not landfill friendly. Not sure about noticing a big change in your utility bill unless you are still using incandescent bulbs which if you are you will see a difference, however you will love the daylight LED brightness versus you florescent bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT LAST YEARS AS CLAIM AND USE SAME AMOUNT OF ELECTRICITY
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these LED bulbs because they say they last several years. Here I am, a little over two years after purchase and several have had to be replaced. Also, I replaced EVERY bulb in my home with these and did not notice ANY decreases in my electric bill. The bill is the same!. They claim these don't use as much electricity and they last a very long time. They DO NOT! Better off buying regular bulbs. I wish they could be held to this several year claim as I would want a refund after replacing them just over two years.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: While these bulbs make the same life expectancy claim as all LED lights, you will be lucky if they last longer than 2 years. I bought 32 of these bulbs in 2017 and 16-18 have burnt out. Since they only cost about $1 per bulb, I’m not overly surprised that the quality is lower than competitors. They do work as light for a good length of time and the energy savings is still present. It would be awesome to have them last longer but knowing that they fail without warning have some on backup and you won’t be as disappointed when they stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Work exactly like regular bulbs, great price
customer_reviews.text: I am changing all our bulbs out to LED as they burn out. We have a reasonable number of recessed lights and I wanted them to all have the same bulbs. I hate the cold blue light if some led bulbs so I experimented with a few different types from local stores before I found this line. The light is warm but clear and they dim without weird humming. This price was significantly less than buying seperatly or in boxes of three in local stores.
customer_reviews.author: TKCMOMO2

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs last about 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Engineered to fail! First they might start flickering... you think oh that’s weird, but when 3-4 begin to flicker and others go out you realize they skimped on the electronics. What is sad is the led’s from these would last a decade or more, but the cheap power converter inside goes out in less than a year! Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: SeanReynoldsCS

customer_reviews.title: The light is too white and glaring
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a friend who, bizarrely, is a fanatical environmentalist, yet pretty much burns every light in her house for 16 hours every day. Seriously, lights on full blast in every room, even when nobody is in the room. She installed them and I visited after that, and these are pretty stark and not warm at all. Full white and, actually, somewhat uncomfortable. I wouldn't recommend these for over a dining table or next to a chair where you read. But they do emit a lot of light at relatively low wattage, so that's bonus.
customer_reviews.author: S. K. Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: They don't last
customer_reviews.text: I figured this pack of bulbs would last years. The packaging exclaims "Lasts 10 years", and while everyone knows that number is crap, I was expecting a good few years out of each bulb at least. Instead, I just used the last bulb, and most of them have gone to replacing other bulbs from the pack that went dead inside of 9 months. Most regular incandescent bulbs last longer than that. They have a pleasing, warm light, but I'd never get them again. I expected way more from an established company like Philips. Steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Santee

customer_reviews.title: Short life span.
customer_reviews.text: The light output color is fairly accurate. Don't expect these to last forever as LEDs are so often talked about. In just six months I have already had two fail out of this 16 bulb batch that I ordered in July 2017! Not sure if they have over heated? They were in hallway mounted lights. Otherwise these are pretty decent for the price that ends up around $2 a bulb. But I doubt I made any ROI on energy savings yet to pay for a rather expensive light bulb when compared to an incandescent.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Gere

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought these awhile back but just started to put them in recently when I installed some new lights. Was surprised when 2 of the 7 bulbs in the new lights did not light up when turned on and thought something might be wrong with the fixture. But the brand new bulbs did not function! Ended up checking the other bulbs to be sure they were OK which they were. But getting 2 bad out of 16 expensive LED's is not a good battling average! Thought Phillips was quality but I guess not.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, super efficient, perfect light color.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Philps LED bulbs for almost five years now. One of the things I really appreciate about Philips is their consistent color. I've noticed that not all 2700K rated bulbs actually output a consistent color. And that's fine if you have lamps in different rooms but much of my living space is open concept so the consistent color is important to me. All my lamps use Philips bulbs. And now as the builder-installed LED bulbs are burning out after 18 months, I am replacing with Philips bulbs in other fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Wade

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for about a year now and many of them have started to fail. The ones in glass globes I can write off as heat dissipation problems, but a lot of the ones I've used are not closed off and 4 of them in particular are in my bedroom where I don't leave the lights on 24/7 or even anywhere close to it and the bulbs have failed. They do get really hot even when not covered.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Hot White Light
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great for ceiling fans, or anything else you may need to put them in. The heatsinks at the bottom of the bulbs though can get extremely hot, so be careful with handling them if they've been on for a while. Otherwise the top of the bulbs are amazingly cool to the touch, and you can actually keep the palm of your hand over them because of how well the heat sinks to the bottom of the bulb. So if you're looking for some good white light in your house, these'll get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Lolifoxer

customer_reviews.title: Wow LED’s have gotten cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been having some of recent led bulbs burning out on me. Others are not putting out close to the number of lumens that they advertise. At least initially these Philips appear brighter at a 40 watt equivalent than my past 60 watt leds. I took one star off for the packaging of the product. The exterior Amazon box was undamaged, but the Philips box inside was badly dented. Two bulbs were broken , but not enough to justify a return.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Johnson

customer_reviews.title: All burning out, one by one
customer_reviews.text: From the description: "Each light bulb is expected to deliver a lifetime of up to 10,950 hours and 10 years" Now, 2 years later, almost all of these bulbs have burnt out, and the rest are starting to flicker, signalling their imminent demise.
customer_reviews.author: ryan weaver

customer_reviews.title: Does precisely what the description indicates....
customer_reviews.text: Note -- these are non-dimmable so they are cheaper than those that can be dimmed. I used these everywhere I had incandescent bulbs as I am on my way of getting rid of these archaic bulbs. Incandescents are hot - and get the way in seconds after applying AC-power. More heat producing devices are NOT appreciated in FL in the summer or even now! Plus, these old style bulbs burn a lot of energy- needlessly - in producing all this heat! Last remark: yo can get the 6000K or 2700-3200 K temperature LED bulbs and "tune" your light color, something hard for incandescents to do. These Philips worked right out of the box and not one had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. Bought in June 2017. So far, they all work great. No bad ones and the don't hum or buzz at all. Nice Warm light and they stay very cool. The base gets warm but not so hot you can't touch it. Way less heat than the CFLs I was using before, and a third the wattage for the same light. My local home stores don't sell bulk packs of these and their prices are crazy compared to these.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Too blue and bright.
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs work fine and do last a very long time. I just hate the tone of the light. It’s not warm or soft enough. I use 15 watt or 25 watt CFL’s and these aren’t even close to the warm golden tone a CFL gives off. I’m very selective on my lighting and these just are not for me. I’m using them in my garage and basement storage - utilitarian spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Designer

customer_reviews.title: Great LED lamps
customer_reviews.text: These look just like conventional frosted incandescent bulbs. Great for light fixtures where you can see the bulb. The full glass envelope all the way to the metal base is nice. Color is great and natural looking. Nice and bright. Virtually impossible to tell these from conventional bulbs. Only knock is the large stamp/label on the top of the bulb. Somewhat unsightly when off but not visible when on so no need to knock any stars off the rating.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01CAL1EMY/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_2
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the package yesterday and was very pleased with the packaging. The bulbs are working as expected with the pleasant, homely incandescent hue. All sixteen bulbs have not yet been put into operation but I expect all of them to perform the same way. By the way the use of these LED bulbs will help to reduce your electricity bill. I have been using LED bulbs for more than a year with exceptional results.
customer_reviews.author: Henry E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: So far so good & excellent vibrant light!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised by the brightness of these lights. I've had a good experience with the majority of Phillips products that I've purchased over the years, and thus far these seem to be in tune with that trend. My main concern when ordering was the brightness of the bulbs, for 5 watts per bulb the amount of light output is quite simply put, amazing. I would highly recommend these, I personally purchased the daylight white and these are an excellent example of what good daylight white bulbs should be. I hope this is helpful. Thank you for taking the time to read my review.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.J.B

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs died within 18-24 months
customer_reviews.text: When a reputed company like Philips says, "10,950 hours and 10 years of light (based on three hours per day)" and I use my bulbs 5-6 hours a day, I expect to get 5 years of life. But in reality, my bulbs died within 1.5-2 years -- far short of the Philips promise. I bought 4 of these when they were selling for $21. Now Philips has jacked up the price from $21 to $30 - ridiculous. No way I am buying them at this price, knowing they will barely last 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: TrollHntr

customer_reviews.title: These have bulb information printed on the end of the bulb
customer_reviews.text: I hope that these will last awhile but I just received them so I cannot comment on their durability. However, I was disappointed to find that the bulb information is printed at the end of the bulb. In a lamp with a lampshade, this is fine. However, I purchased them primarily for ceiling fans and I would have preferred a clean bulb with no printing on the glass like Sylvania does.
customer_reviews.author: William Winner

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright
customer_reviews.text: I researched how to purchase LEDs based on lumens and how they approximately compare to watts. These are much brighter than the comparable watt bulb. A bit too harsh for the living room and hallway. I need to buy a colored silk scarf to throw over my lamp to warm up the light. I would buy a soft white LED instead. But if it’s super brightness you want, then this is the right bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Raise your hand if you enjoy buying light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Nobody? Yeah, us neither. The problem is they come with a warranty, but are you going to track your 10,000,000 hours or whatever the guarantee is? Me either. So we just keep buying and replacing bulbs because that's the racket. We do like how these look.
customer_reviews.author: El Conquistador

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: First time LED bulb purchaser.... I was hesitant to purchase these as soft white because I strongly dislike soft white incandescent and CFL bulbs, just not bright enough, but I also can't use daylight bulbs because they give me headaches. Well, let me tell you. My hubby and I just bought a home, and the bulbs in my living room fans had all sorts of mismatching and different wattage bulbs so it was giving me a headache. Holy s***. These LEDs are bright. I feel like I was given another lighting fixture in my living room. It's awesome. They have that nice warm color but they actually light up the room.
customer_reviews.author: hilde wunderbar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty stoked on these lights
customer_reviews.text: Pretty stoked on these lights! I finally changed out all my crappy squiggly flourescents which I don't like at all - they were supposed to be an environmentally friendly alternative to the old traditional bulbs...then it turns out they're full of mercury and have to be disposed of like toxic waste. So I finally removed them all and put in all LED bulbs - and I love the new light! Makes so much difference. And what a great price too. Highly recommend these bulbs! If you're on the fence - go for it. You'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: LittleGreenWingsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: We decided to go with the daylight instead of soft whites because my eyes aren’t quite as good as they were when I was younger
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Philips 60-Watt Equivalent A19 LED Light Bulb (16 Pack) to replace older incandescent and CFL. We decided to go with the daylight instead of soft whites because my eyes aren’t quite as good as they were when I was younger. Wow. These lights are fantastic! My wife came home from work and the pleasant, bright kitchen was the first thing she noticed. She doesn’t normally notice such things. The light distribution appears to be uniform and the light is not too blue; it appears white to us. There is no buzzing or humming. These have become our light bulb of choice for future applications.
customer_reviews.author: Horatio

customer_reviews.title: Great Soft White (yellow) bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I bought soft white (yellow) bulbs for rooms and bathrooms, received it week ago and till now it is great. the brightness is not that high which is good for small spaces not to be annoying. if your room is big you will need more watts than 60. or two bulbs at least for one room (and that what i did). i believe that soft white is much better than day light for your home.
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Don't last as long as promised
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pack of 16 and used 6 so far, of which 2 have failed in well under two years. I see that the warranty is only good for two years and is difficult to get warranty service, and while they "expect" the bulbs to last for 10,000 hours, they do not warranty it. It's still worth getting LED bulbs to save the environment, but these do not live up to their billing.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: OK bulb - but life is much shorter than advertised
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are OK. However they last about 1 year each with about 9 hours a day of use. The life claimed on the package is about 10 years with 3 hours a day of use. Out of the 10 bulbs I have installed, 6 have burned out in about a year to year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced most of the bulbs in my house with these. I haven't gotten my next power bill so idk the difference it has made. I assume it will be a great difference over time since I was replacing 60 watt incandescent bulbs, effectively cutting down the power consumption like seven-fold.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Adkins

customer_reviews.title: 25% failed after just over a 1.5 yrs
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pack of these bc Philip's is a well known brand and I expected good quality. The bulbs started out well and I was pleased. About a year and a half in and 4 of the first 12 have failed and I have another one flickering occasionally. Haven't tried to get them replaced by warranty yet, but haven't read good things there. Moving to another brand I know stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Aprimefan

customer_reviews.title: Almost 3yrs & no where near the expected lifetime
customer_reviews.text: Bought these back in 2017 and its now 2020 so i figured i could leave a review based on my experience. I thought phillips would make a quality product but one by one the bulbs burnt out. Ive had one barely glow for months now. No where near the rated lifetime hours. Ive had curly fluorescent bulbs last longer. IMO look at a different brand for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: False and misleading product information - start failing after only 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased August 2017, they started failing 1 year later August 2018. While they are Philips brand, beware they are made in China so they are very bad quality and the claims of their product information for a 10 year life are false and misleading. When will US consumers get smart and stop purchasing this garbage from China (myself included). Fortunately the unfair trade imbalances are being corrected now, which will allow the US to rebuild its factories, and we can start purchasing higher quality US products once again.
customer_reviews.author: OHLR

customer_reviews.title: I like if very much.  So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much. Nice bright white lights for good price. Hope this type of bulbs will last longer than the curly type bulbs I use to use. I remember when the curly type replaced the regular light bulbs and it stated on the box "last 12 years." Ya right 12 years my @#$, it only lasted 2 months. Those curly bulbs were a scam....scam to all of us using them. LED should last a lot longer. So far so good and best of all it's doesn't get hot. Weird.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking and just buy theres no better deal out there.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, are you kidding. Absolutely a no brainer. You can not buy any brand, including these, at a big box store for the price of $22 per 16. You cant even find them for less than $10 for 4 bulbs. This us a stupid crazy price. Bite the bullet and buy as many as it takes to replace every bulb in your home. These are just as bright as the crappy off brand 100 watt equivalent led bulbs I had. Definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the headache
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time or money, these flicker randomly. I originally bought these with the idea if I buy the Phillips light bulbs I won’t have a headache of these flickering later on.... oh was I wrong. Don’t get me wrong they look great however 3 months in the first one started flickering randomly, honestly I thought it had to be a fluke so I replaced it and moved on. Now we are 6 or 7 months after purchase and I have half of them that are flickering and getting worse. So disappointing, just goes to prove name brands are not everything! Don’t buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall N.

customer_reviews.title: Phillips does not stand behind their products
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of the fail already and a third one is starting to flicker. I have tried twice to contact the manufacturer for warranty replacement, with no reply. It would be best to pass on this manufacturers product in this case and purchase from a more reputable company.
customer_reviews.author: KevinB

customer_reviews.title: Not a good deal when half the bulbs don’t work!
customer_reviews.text: Bought in bulk so save money. Now I have to spend more because I installed a new light fixture. Opened up 2 boxes(4 in each box) and put 6 bulbs in my new fixture. 3 bulbs, every other light, did not work. I spend hours wiring, undoing wiring, and rewiring to find out why this new fixture I installed wasn’t working... I did not expect 3 bulbs from 2 unopened boxes to be bad. Teaches me to ever assume again...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S

customer_reviews.title: These are terrible. They seem to work for a little while
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. They seem to work for a little while, now a short while later, they all start flickering and need replaced. It's like the whole pack failed near the same amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jm1984

customer_reviews.title: 60 watts for the price of 8
customer_reviews.text: I was given two lamps that each required 5 light bulbs. I don't want to change bulbs on them regularly, so I bought this 12-pack. The price was perfect and work great in the lamps. They are super bright. The color is halfway between incandescent and fluorescent, which makes for a good balance. The light casts uniformly in all directions. This should be the new standard for LED light bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Däch

customer_reviews.title: Buy them by the boxes
customer_reviews.text: You need to buy boxes at a time to keep replacing the ones that burn out. The old style incandescent has a life about a thousand times longer than these bulbs. There are four in my bedroom in s short time two have already burnt out. Phillips products used to be great but my recent experiences with their premium electric razor and these bulbs ,their brand is worthless now.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Don't last as long as they should
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs started out great. They were nice and bright and a great price (and would honestly earn a full 5 stars). However, after just a couple of months, one started flickering like crazy (think drunk strobe light) every time we flipped on the switch. Here we are, almost exactly 1 year after purchasing and we have lost several of them to this same issue. For bulbs that should last for nearly two years at the MINIMUM (15,000 hours is 625 straight days), losing them in less than a year of intermittent use is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, they don't last...
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other reviews state, they just don't last. The price is among the best I've seen for similar bulbs; however, they still aren't worth it. I believe they advertise a 10 year lifespan, but mine only lasted for about a year. Then they started dying. First they start blinking, then become dull, then finally they die. Don't be lured by the too good to be true price, stay away and purchase another brand!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Light up your life with these lightbulbs
customer_reviews.text: I’m using the daylight bulbs and I like them a lot better than the soft white made a big difference in lighting areas up light brighter white then the soft white so far they’re lasting good very easy to install just make sure you take the old one out first before you try putting the new one in and again be safe use a step ladder do not use chair I’d hate to see anybody get hurt
customer_reviews.author: Superman

customer_reviews.title: Bright Light  Bright Light
customer_reviews.text: I used 3 of these in a new light I got to replace a 5 bulb vanity light over the bathroom sink. Those 5 bulbs were 25Watt, so times 5, it was putting out 125 watts total. Three of these would be a 120 watt equivalent, so I thought it should be a close change. Man was I wrong. Maybe it's because the white light from the LED bulbs seems extra bright to my eyes, even with the 2,000K rating. It's almost like walking into a public bathroom, it's so bright. Three 25 watt equivalent bulbs, at a 1,000K would probably have done perfectly for in there. If you want a bright kitchen, these would be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Eerie Futible

customer_reviews.title: Good energy efficiency 👍
customer_reviews.text: They are nice 👍 I had actually brought led lights from another company and the same night the lightbulbs would like go of and on. I had to take them out. But when I bought this ones I don’t see no problem. They do bright up the place. I’m not into warm light bulbs so I did liked it this with a colder sensation. They don’t hurt to much the eyes light some of the light bulbs. And I don’t know how much they would actually last I had them just 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fountain was here

customer_reviews.title: Better than the dollar store ones
customer_reviews.text: They somehow have a better light. I only switched because the dollar store bulbs started burning out prematurely. These are a little more per bulb but worth it for the soft white I guess. The $ store ones claim they last a long longer but I was having them die within months which is why i switched to these. So far, no problem but if I do, I will return them. Do not need a receipt unless you return things all the time with no receipt.
customer_reviews.author: Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality / lifespan
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs are described here as being "8.5-Watt (60-Watt Equivalent)", but are actually 10 watt. The bulbs in reality are labeled 10W all over the packaging. UPDATE: These bulbs have a very poor lifespan. After 6 months of normal use they are burning out, which is exceptionally bad. I have other LED light bulbs that have been running 24/7 for over 5 years but these with only intermittent use can't even make it a year.
customer_reviews.author: S. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several of the 60w equivalent daylight LED bulbs to replace my 100w equivalent daylight CFLs, and I believe these are as bright as my CFLs. I like the fact that they not only use less electricity, but they also look much nicer than my spiral CFLs and don't flicker. I also don't have to wait for them to warm up to get full brightness, since not all of my old light bulbs were instant-on. The price was also much cheaper than all the stores I checked.
customer_reviews.author: Thaisval

customer_reviews.title: Having Philips LED lightbulbs is like having a nicely tiled floor.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even need lightbulbs when I bought these, I had all new CFL bulbs since I moved in.. I'm so glad that I bought them anyway.. These LED bulbs have already saved me money in the short time I've had them, making a noticeable difference in my power bill. Long story short, if you don't already have LED lightbulbs, you must buy these for your household.
customer_reviews.author: Baer the Lion

product_meta.title: Philips LED Non-Dimmable A19 Frosted Light Bulb: 800-Lumen, 2700-Kelvin, 10-Watt (60-Watt Equivalent), E26 Base, Soft White, 16-Pack
product_meta.description: Size:16 Pack| Style:60-Watt Equivalent| Color:Soft WhiteFix BulletsPhilips A19 LED light bulbs provide 800 lumens of soft white light, equivalent to 60-watt incandescent with 80% less energy use. These bulbs fit standard medium base (E26) fixtures with the look and feel of a classic bulb. Not for use with Philips HUE products. At 2700-Kelvin, these soft white bulbs offer warm and comfortable lighting with high CRI (color rendering index) to deliver bright, crisp color ideal for whole room ambient light as well as in area lamps. These high-value Philips LEDs offer durable, shatter-free plastic construction. Philips LEDs turn on instantly with energy-efficient flicker-free, natural light that won't degrade over time. Unlike cheaper imitations, Philips LED offers clean, natural lighting with exceptional clarity. LED light bulbs last up to 10X longer than incandescent and halogen bulbs. Unlike fluorescent and compact fluorescent bulbs, Philips LEDs are mercury-free so they don't contribute to hazardous waste. Each bulb in this pack of 16 A19 Philips LEDs is expected to deliver a lifetime of up to 10,950 hours and over 10 years (based on three hours per day), saving you the cost and hassle of frequent bulb replacement.
feature_bullets: Energy efficient: Philips LED Non Dimmable A19 Frosted Light Bulbs uses 80 percent less energy than 60 Watt Incandescent Bulbs while maintaining the look and feel of a classic light bulb

Long lasting: These Philips LED bulbs last 10x longer than incandescent and halogen bulbs; Each light bulb is expected to deliver a lifetime of upto 10,950 hours and 10 years of light (based on three hours per day), saving you the cost of frequent bulb replacement
Eco Friendly: Mercury free and uses 80 percent less energy than 60 Watt Incandescent Bulbs
Compatibility: These Philips LED light bulbs fit in E26 medium screw bases; Not compatible with Philips HUE products; Philips LED Non Dimmable A19 light bulbs are for non connected use only

Comfortable light: Our products meet strict test criteria including flicker, strobe, glare and color rendition to ensure they meet EyeComfort requirements; Switch to Philips LED, light that’s designed for the comfort of your eyes

Soft White: Philips LED Non Dimmable A19 light bulbs offer warm and comfortable lighting with high CRI (color rendering index); At 2700 Kelvin the bulbs deliver bright, crisp color ideal for whole room ambient light as well as in area lamps

specifications.Special Features: Warranty can be extended at philips.com/RegisterMyLED, Warranty is longer for Professional / Commerical installation - based on 12 Hours a day 7 days a week, Consumer Warranty based on 3 hours a day 7 days a week
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,673 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
